roemetz.core

Class SimRoeMetz

  • java.lang.Object
    • roemetz.core.SimRoeMetz

  • public class SimRoeMetz
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates scores according to Roe and Metz simulation. Adapted for java from sim_roemetz.pro (Brandon D. Gallas, PhD)
    Author:
    Rohan Pathare

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimRoeMetz

        public SimRoeMetz(double[] tempScoreMeans,
          double[] tempScoreVar,
          umontreal.iro.lecuyer.rng.RandomStream RandomStream0,
          SizePanel sizePanel1Temp)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Sole constructor. Upon invocation, verifies the parameters, initializes class members, performs simulation experiment, and processes the results.
        Parameters:
        tempScoreMeans - Contains experiment means. Has 2 elements.
        tempScoreVar - Contains variance components. Has 18 elements.
        RandomStream0 - Random numbergenerator at its current state
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Used when calling SimRoeMetz as a standalone application via command-line.
        Parameters:
        args - command-line arguments. First element is experiment means, second element is components of variance, third element is experiment sizes, fourth element is seed for RNG, fifth element specifies whether biased estimates will be used.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • printResults

        private void printResults()
        Prints the results of a simulation experiment to standard out. Only used when main method for this class is invoked.

           throws java.io.IOException

        -- InputFile.verifySizesAndGetIDs(boolean)
        -- InputFile.processScoresAndTruth(boolean)

      • fillGaussian

        public double[] fillGaussian(double scalar,
                    long Nreader2)
        Fills a vector with x random numbers according to a Gaussian distribution.
        Parameters:
        scalar - Width of distribution
        Nreader2 - length of vector to fill
        Returns:
        1-d array containing random gaussian numbers

      • fillGaussian

        public double[][] fillGaussian(double scalar,
                      long Nreader2,
                      long Nnormal2)
        Fills a matrix with x * y random numbers according to a Gaussian distribution.
        Parameters:
        scalar - Width of distribution
        Nreader2 - length of array to fill
        Nnormal2 - width of array to fill
        Returns:
        2-d array containing random gaussian numbers
